item.title: [Video] Persuasion Routes
item.description: There are two "routes" used in persuasion: the central route and the peripheral route. Briefly speaking, central route involves informing the target entity of the benefits/features of doing or having something, convincing them that it is actually beneficial to them, while the peripheral persuasion route relies on other techniques
item.dc:creator: John Paul Ada
item.content:encoded:
There are two "routes" used in persuasion: the central route and the peripheral route. Briefly speaking, central route involves informing the target entity of the benefits/features of doing or having something, convincing them that it is actually beneficial to them, while the peripheral persuasion route relies on other techniques aside from demonstrating the features and benefits to grab the the attention and attract the target.

After learning this, we were asked to create two minute-long advertisement videos -- one that uses the central route and one that uses the peripheral route.

Central Route
Peripheral Route

item.title: @niks765 of SoundCloud
item.description: I am a huge fan of SoundCloud's @niks765, A.K.A Niks. Her voice is just so damn sexy.
item.dc:creator: John Paul Ada
item.content:encoded:
I am a BIG fan of @niks765, also known as Niks on SoundCloud. Her cold and sexy voice just penetrates (no pun intended) your insides (again, no pun intended), straight into your soul.

Inasmuch as magnificent voice is perfect for her selection of songs, she backs it up with her guitar skills. And believe me when I say that she's not your ordinary just-strumming-it-winging-it guitar player. No. She's much more than that. Actually, just have a listen at the clips she posts and you'd know.

Her latest SoundCloud post was a cover of Asin's Himig ng Pag-ibig:

This one is apparently an original, with the title, "For Zoe" (which kinda reminds me of Fur Elise, because... yeah):

Her covers of Julianne's Tulak ng Bibig and Beyonce's Crazy in Love are just so damn sexxaayy:

As displayed in her SoundCloud account, she is known in the real world as Katrina Nicole Abuda.

If you think she's talented (and I know you do), do spread the word. Thanks a bunch!

item.title: Search History Prank
item.description: Are you bored? Or want to have revenge? Here's a little prank you can run on your target's browser.
item.dc:creator: John Paul Ada
item.content:encoded:
Are you bored? Want to play a prank on an unsuspecting brother or get back at that annoying colleague that keeps nabbing your lunch (this is soooo not from experience)? Here's a little prank you can run on your target's browser.

This is so clickbait-y but hey, why not try this fun web app called Ruin My Search History 1? Not sure who developed this but it was posted on Product Hunt by Tibor Martini (@ungeruehrt). This app, well, it ruins your search history. Specifically, you click the big blue search button and it fires up a new tab and does Google searches with a bunch of funny, stupid, sick and sometimes downright senseless keywords -- unless you're the kind of person who lurks in the dark corners of Reddit. Or if you're a 4chan newbie, because you know... yeah. Don't get me started on that one.

Ruin My Search History Landing Page

Here are a bunch of the searches that I thought were hilarious:

Search List

This is the list of searches the app did on my browser:

  • donald trump
  • bing
  • syria hotels with pool
  • cheap syria flights western visayas
  • how to join isis
  • isis application form
  • flights philippines
  • country low age of consent
  • why is age of consent so old western visayas
  • age of consent western visayas
  • how to come out as gay to dad
  • signs of being gay
  • does liking men mean im gay
  • best budget penis pumps
  • do penis pumps work
  • average penis size philippines
  • STI test in cadiz
  • common STIs
  • smelly penis cure urgent
  • rohypnol safe dosage
  • seduction guide
  • latest laws incest
  • is incest illegal in philippines attracted to mother why
  • mail order paternity test
  • paternity test
  • ashley madison list cadiz
  • view ashley madison list
  • ashley madison hack
  • how to delete search history in chrome
  • undetectable poisons
  • ways to kill someone hypothetically
  • how to tell if partner cheating
  • sex shop in cadiz
  • engagement rings
  • romantic ways to propose
  • penis remove dog how to
  • how to get back with ex
  • is it normal to still love my ex
  • how to tell partner they fat
  • what counts as fat
  • i hate my boss
  • homemade lube?
  • tall midgets??
  • midget google images
  • why doesnt my poo float
  • your youre difference
  • am i lack toast and tolerant
  • why are my thumbs uneven
  • how to appear funny

Now go and ruin somebody's life -- I mean, search history. *wink

Notes:

1 You might want to go incognito to test this.

item.title: Welcome to Ghost
item.description: You're live! Nice. We've put together a little post to introduce you to the Ghost editor and get you started. You can manage your content by signing in to the admin area at <your blog URL>/ghost/. When you arrive, you can select this post from a list
item.dc:creator: John Paul Ada
item.content:encoded:
You're live! Nice. We've put together a little post to introduce you to the Ghost editor and get you started. You can manage your content by signing in to the admin area at <your blog URL>/ghost/. When you arrive, you can select this post from a list on the left and see a preview of it on the right. Click the little pencil icon at the top of the preview to edit this post and read the next section!

Getting Started

Ghost uses something called Markdown for writing. Essentially, it's a shorthand way to manage your post formatting as you write!

Writing in Markdown is really easy. In the left hand panel of Ghost, you simply write as you normally would. Where appropriate, you can use shortcuts to style your content. For example, a list:

  • Item number one
  • Item number two
    • A nested item
  • A final item

or with numbers!

  1. Remember to buy some milk
  2. Drink the milk
  3. Tweet that I remembered to buy the milk, and drank it

Links

Want to link to a source? No problem. If you paste in a URL, like http://ghost.org - it'll automatically be linked up. But if you want to customise your anchor text, you can do that too! Here's a link to the Ghost website. Neat.

What about Images?

Images work too! Already know the URL of the image you want to include in your article? Simply paste it in like this to make it show up:

Not sure which image you want to use yet? That's ok too. Leave yourself a descriptive placeholder and keep writing. Come back later and drag and drop the image in to upload:

Quoting

Sometimes a link isn't enough, you want to quote someone on what they've said. Perhaps you've started using a new blogging platform and feel the sudden urge to share their slogan? A quote might be just the way to do it!

Ghost - Just a blogging platform

Working with Code

Got a streak of geek? We've got you covered there, too. You can write inline <code> blocks really easily with back ticks. Want to show off something more comprehensive? 4 spaces of indentation gets you there.

.awesome-thing {
    display: block;
    width: 100%;
}

Ready for a Break?

Throw 3 or more dashes down on any new line and you've got yourself a fancy new divider. Aw yeah.

Advanced Usage

There's one fantastic secret about Markdown. If you want, you can write plain old HTML and it'll still work! Very flexible.

That should be enough to get you started. Have fun - and let us know what you think :)
